text: <@U11TAFPUP> - can you provide some more details on exactly what you are doing?
<@U17BRDHPG>: <@U11L9NAUW> <@U0KPFAZNF> it would help greatly if whatever is “being worked on” were somehow associated with a proposed feature or issue that articulates what is being done, and why
hi <@U0KM61BCP> I'm writing on this, the issues associated are #1620 + #2269 and I'm documenting the resolution proposal so I'll share this one when is was ready.
writing = working
<@U11L9NAUW>: ETA?
durying this week I'll send the poposal.
Last time we discussed this, the validity period + revocation methods (for certificates) were highlighted as dependencies.

We can/should probably update issue 1620 with details... (I'll put together my thoughts regarding the separation of the Authorization bit, that is, who is allowed to 'delete' a user.... vs. what does the 'delete' action actually means).
We need to both keep 'history' (logging, reporting, auditing)...

... and make sure that we mistakenly don't work in a centralized fashion. Otherwise, it's 1) not scalable 2) not intuitive (e.g., @ghaskin's comments above are just one example) 3) we should probably not push the synchronization work to the clients (especially as the decision making point is @ the ECA in the first place)
There are a few ways to solve it, but/and everybody should feel free to comment and reply to Keith's questions (from last month) with suggestions/views.
In short, I'm of the opinion that we should be strict/clearer WRT the  'Authorization', which Keith highlighted.
And that we should make sure that we get the 'How' bit right.
<@U0YLVSWE4>
<@U11MANG9G>: please add your comments in 1620
Yes, will do. We might have a dependency here on some of Dulce's work.

Sounds good!
